reference.shortdesc: Lines are lines of text where line breaks are significant but white space is not. It can be used to represent dialogs, poetry, or other text fragments where line breaks are significant.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Although rendering is left up to the implementation, processors typically use the following conventions:

ul.li: Extra white space within the lines element is not preserved.
The font style is not monospaced.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , , and .

example.title: Example
example.codeblock:
This is a sample of my favorite sonnet:

Shall I compare thee to a summer's day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, and summer's lease hath all too short a date: ...
example.p: Though exact formatting will vary, the previous sample will typically be rendered as follows.
